abstract: Office of Special Counsel report finds United States Comission for the Preservation of America's Heritage Abroad violated federal contracting rules by employing registered federal lobbyist Jeffrey Farrow as executive director, paying him more than $100,000 for part-time work.
lead_paragraph: A government report found that the Commission for the Preservation of America’s Heritage Abroad, which employed a registered federal lobbyist as its executive director, violated federal rules.

headline.main: U.S. Inquiry Finds Agency Chief Violated Rules
headline.print_headline: U.S. Inquiry Finds Agency Chief Violated Rules

snippet: A government report found that the Commission for the Preservation of America’s Heritage Abroad, which employed a registered federal lobbyist as its executive director, violated federal rules.
